title._content: Oldest House in Keene New Hampshire

description._content: TITLE Oldest House in Keene New Hampshire CREATOR Whitehouse, Bion, Keene NH SUBJECT Houses - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of "the Oldest house in Keene", the Heaton house, built circa 1750 by Seth Heaton, one of the proprietors of Upper Ashuelot. It is located at 500 Marlboro St. and has been extensively remodeled. The house was built across the pathway from Heaton's first house, a log cabin which was burnt by the Indians in 1747. Four of Seth's sons were Revolutionary soldiers. He left the house to his youngest son, Samuel when he died in 1787. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County DATE DIGITAL 20110511 DATE ORIGINAL 1900-1920? RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykwhk239 (7-80) RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known copyright restrictions.
